duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide geotechnical engineering support on Transportation Projects.
Perform independent evaluations using standard techniques and procedures, making minor adoptions and modifications as required.
Make decisions and recommendations in reference to test report results, project field circumstances, and inspections.
Prepare and review geotechnical reports for projects as per specifications.
Assign work/tasks to staff as applicable.
Prepare scopes, budgets, and schedules for task assignments.
Maintain and leverage client relationships, and develop new project opportunities.
Attend client site meetings and communicate effectively with clients and project teams.
Train technical staff and perform on-site observations or inspections.
Adhere to safety practices and policies to ensure personal safety and the safety of others at work.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in accredited engineering /ABET school and a Master’s Degree in Geotechnical Engineering
